org.graalvm.polyglot.proxy

Interface Proxy

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ProxyArray, ProxyExecutable, ProxyNativeObject, ProxyObject, ProxyPrimitive

    public interface Proxy
    Proxy interfaces allow to mimic guest language objects in Graal languages. For example, one can implement the ProxyObject interface and then pass the object to a guest language. The guest language will then treat this instance as an object. Multiple proxy interfaces can be implemented at the same time. So in a configuration a value can be an array and an object at the same time.

    If an object directly and exclusively implements the Proxy interface then the object can be passed around in guest language. However, most operations with the value in guest language will fail.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    to mimic arrays, to mimic objects, to mimic functions, to mimic native objects, to mimic primitive values
